Article I (Specification Primacy).evidence: All designs trace to FR-01 through FR-07 and AC identifiers. Interface spec maps every component to requirement traces. Module design includes requirement traceability for each module.

Article IV (Explicit Over Implicit).evidence: All design decisions documented with rationale. No [NEEDS CLARIFICATION] markers remain. ADR-0005, ADR-0006, ADR-0007 referenced for key decisions. TC-06 and TC-07 conditional behavior explicitly documented.

Article V (Simplicity First).evidence: Design extends existing patterns without new abstractions. No new debate engine, no new skill IDs, no new hooks. Single row addition to DEBATE_ROUTING table. Additive modifications only.

Article VII (Artifact Traceability).evidence: Every component traces to specific FR/AC/NFR/C identifiers. Validation rules include traces arrays. Module design has Traces field per module.

Article IX (Quality Gate Integrity).evidence: All required design artifacts produced and validated. Interface spec, module designs, error taxonomy, validation rules, component specs, and user flows all complete.

interface_specification_complete.details: Interface contracts defined for all 7 components: orchestrator routing, critic agent, refiner agent, creator awareness, skills manifest, isdlc.md, test file

all_modules_designed.details: 7 modules designed with clear responsibilities, interfaces, dependencies, and implementation order

ui_wireframes.details: Non-UI project (agent-based framework). No wireframes applicable.

user_flows_documented.details: Mermaid flowchart documenting complete debate loop lifecycle including error paths and escalation

error_taxonomy_complete.details: 8 check categories (TC-01..TC-08) with severity, triggers, templates. Debate loop error handling. Escalation protocol.

validation_rules_defined.details: 34 validation rules across 7 categories covering agent structure, critic checks, refiner fixes, routing, creator awareness, and manifest

designs_cover_all_requirements.details: All 7 FRs (FR-01 through FR-07), 4 NFRs, 4 constraints mapped to module designs. All ACs (AC-01.1 through AC-07.6) traced to specific design elements.

interface_contracts_reviewed.details: Input/output contracts defined for all agent interfaces. DEBATE_CONTEXT schema documented. Critique report format specified. Change log format specified.

component_specifications_complete.details: Reusable patterns documented: critic pattern, refiner pattern, creator awareness pattern, DEBATE_ROUTING pattern, CJS test pattern

pattern_consistency_check.module_consistency: PASS - new agents follow existing 04-*.md naming and structure from design-critic/design-refiner
pattern_consistency_check.naming_consistency: PASS - kebab-case for files, B-NNN/W-NNN for findings, TC-NN for checks
pattern_consistency_check.error_consistency: PASS - same BLOCKING/WARNING severity system as existing debate teams
pattern_consistency_check.validation_consistency: PASS - same CJS test pattern (node:test + node:assert/strict) as existing tests

notes: UI wireframes not applicable (non-UI project per GATE-03 N/A clause)
Design follows established debate team patterns from Phases 01, 03, 04
ADR-0005 (agent prefix), ADR-0006 (no new skills), ADR-0007 (manifest scope) all respected
TC-08 (Orphan Test Case) is WARNING, all others BLOCKING per requirements
